Frank, try not to be so defensive when someone disagrees with you.

Not all=
 alternate opinions are 'debunking". Discussion, different processes, diffe=
rent viewpoints, all add to research.=C2=A0 Everyone marching to the same t=
une, and all agreeing, doesn't.

If you want to say people hear different t=
hings because of individualized messages, or psychic components, nothing is=
 stopping you.=C2=A0 If someone else wants to say there is no psychic compo=
nent, and that telling someone what they should hear can cause bias, they s=
hould be free to. 

The brave ones will test their claims.=C2=A0 Those who =
make claims, and insist they cannot be tested.. well... "most of us are sma=
rt enough to know" (your term) what that really means.



--- On Wed, 5/26/=
10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

pe?

=



=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      =C2=A0Soooooo, do you just hang =
out on these groups to bebunk, or do you have an actual interest in EVP?
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0You can explain anything away if you need that, but most of us=
 are smart enough to know when we are fooling ourselves and when there is s=
omething real going on.=C2=A0=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Who needs this constant --=
this is what you're really hearing-- BS explanations?=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0E=
VP is far more complicated than just cut and dried sounds, there=C2=A0is ps=
ychic component, where you're using the sound as a psychic prop for your ow=
n senses. There's the messages tuned to a specific individual, so no one is=
 going ot hear it the same if at all. Everyone is wired different, and just=
 because no two poeple hear an EVP the same does not invalidate it. 

=C2=
=A0
=C2=A0Maybe you should go debunk music, no one hears songs the same eit=
her. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S

But only=C2=A0 when they're told what t=
o listen for.=C2=A0 For noise-type sounds (rather than radio-broadcast snip=
pets), they still hear different things when left to listen without being t=
old what they are supposed to hear first.

A simpler explanation is that, when listening to ambiguous audio, you te=
nd to interpret the noise in the context of your current state of mind. It =

pirit activity in the electronics or on the media.


Seems to me.
